532 Gallery Jaeckel
DIANA COPPERWHITE:
Desert, 2025
Oil on canvas
18 × 24 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$3000
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

Evoking arid expanses in layered colors, this piece harmonizes real-life and media-sourced imagery into a dreamlike vista, critically assessing painting’s role in capturing fleeting ideas with subtle, trance-like depth.

About the artist:

In her paintings, Diana Copperwhite explores the relationship between colors, gestures, figuration, and representation, harmonizing different visual strategies on the canvas. Copperwhite amalgamates images from the internet, photographs, and real life, unifying these sources in paintings that critically assess the medium’s ability to represent images, sensations, and ideas.

Diana Copperwhite was born in 1969 in Limerick, Ireland, and lives and works in Dublin. She studied at the Limerick School of Art and Design, received a BA in painting at the National College of Art and Design, Dublin, and an MFA at the Winchester School of Art and Design, Barcelona.

Copperwhite has had solo exhibitions including “Reflections in a Darker Mirror” (2022–2023), “The Clock Struck Between Time” reviewed in Brooklyn Rail (2019), and “Depend on the Morning Sun” reviewed in Hyperallergic (2017). She has participated in recent group exhibitions at CAN Ibiza Art Fair (2025), CONTEXT Art Miami (2022), and “Anarene” (2023).

View Full Artist Profile
